The span of his active NFL career, including six seasons with the Buccaneers and one with the Raiders.

keyTakeAways: Former NFL running back Doug Martin died after a brief struggle with police during an arrest related to a home break-in in Oakland.
Martin, a 36-year-old former All-Pro player with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, was taken into custody on Saturday and transported to a hospital where he died.
The cause of death has not been released, and an autopsy will be conducted.
Martin was selected as one of the top 50 players in Tampa Bay Buccaneers franchise history.
His family requested privacy during their grief, and Oakland Mayor Barbara Lee expressed condolences.
The incident raises broader concerns about police interactions with individuals in the public eye, especially those from marginalized communities or with criminal investigations.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL running back Doug Martin, a 36-year-old former All-Pro with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died after a brief struggle with Oakland police officers while being detained for a suspected home break-in. He was taken into custody early Saturday and later transported to a hospital, where he passed away. The cause of death has not been released, and an autopsy is pending. Martin, selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft, was recognized for his rushing performance and named to the Pro Bowl twice, and was later named one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers history. The Oakland Police Department and Mayor Barbara Lee expressed condolences, and the family requested privacy during their grief. This incident raises broader public questions about police conduct and interactions with individuals from diverse backgrounds, especially in the context of criminal investigations.
title: Former NFL Player Doug Martin Dies After Struggle With Police During Detention
